Now that you can move around, you’ll want to remember some of the things you see. For instance, the signs there have a message we want you to say, but you have to read it first, and then remember it. You can store things like numbers and text (called strings) in variables. To use a variable, just assign a value to a name, like mynum = 5. Now mynum has remembered the number five for later. Objects can also have variables. The signs on the screen have a text variable unique to each sign. If you’re facing the sign, you can call the get_in_front() method to reference the sign object, and then add a dot and the word text at the end to reference its text. (Just like the methods that began with move_, you can use turn_left, turn_right, turn_up, and turn_down to change which direction you’re facing.) Tell your friend what a sign says.
